item.title: Mario Kart World Revealed As Nintendo Switch 2 Launch Title
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/mario-kart-world-revealed-as-nintendo-switch-2-launch-title/

Nintendo has officially announced Mario Kart World for the Nintendo Switch 2. After being teased during the console’s initial reveal, we have confirmation it’s skidding onto the Switch 2 as a debut launch title.

The long-awaited reveal came during the company’s Nintendo Direct Switch 2 unveiling event on April 2. Mario Kart World, AKA Mario Kart 9, is the follow-up to 2014’s Mario Kart 8 for the Wii U. The game was also rereleased on the original Nintendo Switch in 2017 as Mario Kart 8 Deluxe. Since then, it has grown to receive dozens of new tracks and many new characters for players.

But it’s time for a pit stop as we’re ready to go full throttle in Mario Kart World.

Nintendo Switch 2 Direct Announces Mario Kart World

Mario Kart World will support races with up to 24 players, confirming what many believed after the original tease in January, and introduces new dynamic levels and even rail grinding!

We’ve only seen a handful of Mario Kart World footage, but I can already tell you we’re going to lose hundreds of hours to Mario-theme circuits all over again!

Are you going to pick up Mario Kart World on the Nintendo Switch 2? Let us know down below, and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming forums.

item.title: Nintendo Switch 2 Nintendo Direct: Everything Announced
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/nintendo-switch-2-nintendo-direct-everything-announced/

It’s been eight years since the original the Nintendo Switch was revealed to fans. Now it’s time for the world to get a full look at its successor, the Nintendo Switch 2 with a special Nintendo Direct presentation.

The event will last around 60 minutes in total and feature a full look at the console, its features, release plans, and even launch games. One game many expect to be revealed is the next Mario Kart title, Mario Kart 9. It should also be assumed that Nintendo will drop a few surprise announcements to get fans excited about its latest system.

The show begins at 9am ET/6am PT on Wednesday and will be updated throughout. That means all of the announcements below is listed in the order they appeared.

Before and during the show, make sure you let us know down below what you are most excited about with the Nintendo Switch 2. And join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming forums.

Everything Announced At The Nintendo Switch 2 Nintendo Direct

Mario Kart World

Nintendo kicked off the show with its latest installment of the Mario Kart franchise, Mario Kart World. The game will launch exclusively for Nintendo Switch 2. It features a free roam, 24-player races, and rolling starts. The game will launch on the same day as the Nintendo Switch 2.

The C Is For Chatting

Nintendo has lifted the veil off the mysterious “C” button. The new “GameChat” button will allow players to chat with other players online through the console for the first time. This seemingly removes the need for the third-party app that online players of the original Nintendo Switch required. It also allows for screen sharing between players.

Using GameChat requires Nintendo Switch Online.

Nintendo Switch 2 Game Share

Nintendo Switch 2 allows players to share games and play select games together without the need for multiple copies.

Nintendo Switch 2’s Features

The company gave an overview of the console’s features, and it’s a big list. New features include 4K HDR support, 120 FPS, Joy-Cons that can be used as mice, multiple USB-C ports, and more.

Release Date

The Nintendo Switch 2 will launch on June 5.

Switch 2 Enhanced Games

Games like Super Mario Party Jamboree will received Nintendo Switch 2 enhancements for the new console.

Developing story…

item.title: Schedule 1 is a Sleeper Indie Hit Dominating Steam with Nearly Half a Million Concurrent Players
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/schedule-1-is-a-sleeper-indie-hit-dominating-steam-with-nearly-half-a-million-concurrent-players/

It’s time for another breakout sensation in the indie gaming space. We always love to see it, and Schedule 1 has come out of nowhere to occupy millions of hours of players’ playtime to create kingpins in the making.

Step aside, REPO, it’s time for Schedule 1 to shine. I say that, but REPO continues to smash it and show there’s hope for all indie titles. Now and again, a game comes out of nowhere to RKO the gaming scene. Balatro did it in 2024, Among Us before it, and now Schedule 1 is doing the same.

Oddly enough, unlike REPO, which attracted a decent amount of Steam Wishlist interest, Schedule 1 has been even more low-key. This hasn’t stopped hundreds of millions of players from literally cooking up a storm.

What is Schedule 1?

Schedule 1 is a crime simulator where you need to cultivate drugs and grow your vast empire across Hyland Point. Its official Steam page says: “Produce a range of drugs to satisfy your customers, each one with its own unique production process. Discover special recipes to create new drug variants with special properties.”

I can’t think of many drug simulators off the top of my head. This is probably why Schedule 1 has amassed an all-time peak of 412,713 concurrent players. We’re only 10 days removed from launch, making this figure even more staggering.

Right now, Schedule 1 is currently fourth in Steam’s “Top Games” list, and word of mouth is spreading minute by minute. For comparison, REPO’s all-time peak is 266,908—another unbelievable feat.

The sky is currently the limit for Schedule 1. With an extensive roadmap of content already planned and potential console ports on the cards, we’ll take a step back now and enjoy this high.

item.title: Schedule 1 Roadmap & All Future Content—Fishing, Shooting Mini-Games, Bribery & More
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/schedule-1-roadmap-all-future-content-fishing-shooting-mini-games-bribery-more/

Schedule 1 attracted several hundred thousand players in its first week alone. The developer has outlined a consistent line of plans and future content updates for Schedule 1 through a detailed roadmap.

If you took one look at Schedule 1 as an outsider, you’d think it was a South Park-inspired game about drugs. The art style could sway this argument, but Schedule 1 is big and beastly enough to cement its own identity and status as one of 2025’s biggest indie titles.

Developer TVGS is releasing a lot of patches to keep the experience smooth and steady. But Schedule 1’s future is looking very bright, and we’ve looked at what we’ve all got to look forward to.

All Upcoming Schedule 1 Content

Here’s a look at the developer’s ideas for Schedule 1 and which category they fall under. We love the transparency, and it means if you’re enjoying Schedule 1, you have tangible reasons to keep coming back.

Schedule 1 Roadmap Explained

The official Schedule 1 Trello board has an extensive list of “Monthly Update Ideas and “Smaller Additions/Improvements.” These are listed under the “Schedule 1 Roadmap,” and each list features an assortment of new activities, gameplay ideas, mechanics, and quality-of-life ideas.

An “In Progress” column also exists. As of writing, this is empty, so we presume TVGS is focusing on either taking some downtime to recover from the overwhelming start, hasn’t updated the Schedule 1 Trello yet, or is getting ready to work on a new update.

We’ll keep checking in to see what new ideas are floating around for Schedule 1.

Can Schedule 1 keep up its phenomenal early momentum? Or will it succumb to fatigue and the novelty wearing off? Let us know through the Insider Gaming Forum where daily conversations are happening!

item.title: Is Schedule 1 on PlayStation or Xbox? Console Status Explained
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/is-schedule-1-on-playstation-or-xbox-console-status-explained/

Steam has been flooded by players desperate to play Schedule 1—a sleeper breakthrough. It’s shot to popularity on PC, but we’re here to see if you can play it on PlayStation or Xbox consoles.

It’s amazing what the power of the grapevine and word of mouth can do. 2025’s indie sensation was REPO for the longest time, but in the blink of an eye, Schedule 1 kindly asked it to move over. Your meteoric ascendancy to head of Hyland Point is fueled by drugs, and the unique gameplay has turned more than a few heads.

Its player count has dominated the top of Steam Charts for a while, so let’s see if PlayStation and Xbox users can get in on the deal.

Can You Play Schedule 1 on PS5?

As per the Schedule 1 Discord, you can’t play the crime simulator on PlayStation 4 or PlayStation 5 as it stands.

The Schedule 1 Discord is home to all answers and questions about the game. But one that pops up frequently is if the title is lining up a PS4 or PS5 experience anytime soon.

Unfortunately, the answer is a definite no for now. This might change in the future, though, depending on the success of the indie title—although if it carries on this way it won’t be “indie” for much longer!

Can You Play Schedule 1 on Xbox Series X|S?

It’s also bad news for Microsoft fans as Schedule 1 isn’t available on Xbox Series X|S.

Let’s head back to the Schedule 1 Discord for a second. An official question is posed asking: “Will it (Schedule I) be available on Xbox/Playstation?” The developer has answered this: “Unfortunately not on release, but potentially in the future, depending on how gracious Sony/Microsoft are.“

I’m not entirely sure what they mean by “how gracious Sony/Microsoft are.” This might relate to the nature of the content and not allowing it on the PS or Xbox Store, but I feel this is unlikely, as we’ve seen worse. Regardless, like any indie hit on Steam, the initial buzz for Schedule 1 is outrageous, and it’s a huge success.

If the game can buck the trend of seeing its initial popularity disappear and become a long-standing hit in the vein of an Among Us, it would be dope to see it on PS5 and Xbox Series X|S later on.

Converse with fellow Schedule 1 players in our Insider Gaming Official Forum. You can talk about the new title, whether you think it can keep its success going, and ask for specific guides for the game.
